enWisdom: Generosity is [true] leadership, sovereignty is [only] administration
Munificence is the best eminence

Wisdom: الْمَالُ يُكْرِمُ صَاحِبَهُ مَا بَذَلَهُ وَيُهِينُهُ مَا بَخِلَ بِهِ
enWisdom: Wealth honours its possessor as long as he spends it and abases him when he is miserly with it
Give generously and you will be honoured
Bestow goodness and you shall advance
Give generously and you shall gain authority

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا سَادَةُ أَهْلِ الدُّنْيَا [وَ الْآخِرَةِ] الْأَجْوَادُ
enWisdom: Verily the masters of the people of this world (and the Hereafter) are the generous
By doing good to others, ranks get elevated
Through generosity, authority is acquired
Through generosity, men gain authority
Through increased tolerance, one’s merit (or intelligence) increases
Through generosity, distinction is established and praise is acquired
Do good to others and you will be served, show clemency and you will be put forward (or you will advance)
Be generous and you will gain authority; be patient and you will be triumphant

Wisdom: جُودُ الْفَقِيرِ يُجِلُّهُ وَبُخْلُ الْغَنِيِّ يُذِلُّهُ
enWisdom: The generosity of a poor person dignifies him and the stinginess of a rich person debases him
The cause of ascendancy is generosity
The chiefs of the people of Paradise are the generous and the pious

Wisdom: سَادَةُ النَّاسِ فِي الدُّنْيَا الْأَسْخِيَاءُ وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ الْأَتْقِيَاءُ
enWisdom: The eminent among the people in this world are the generous ones and in the Hereafter, the God-wary
One who generously gives [from] his wealth becomes great
One who is generous gains authority

Wisdom: لَا سِيَادَةَ لِمَنْ لَا سَخَاءَ لَهُ
enWisdom: There is no eminence in the one who lacks generosity
